0f870ace0a4b9665e30aafebc5bc149c (20:04): is it possible to do something like this: http://rafb.net/paste/results/iji4cz32.html
0f870ace0a4b9665e30aafebc5bc149c (20:04): in valid xhtml 1.1 ?
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (20:05): dpy: Well, I'm not sure of the exact syntax, the moment you do that it stops being XHTML 1.1, and IE won't support it (since it doesn't do XHTML 1.1 anyway).
06349befb796253bcead57bcff9f6ca7 (20:10): If anyone knows someone who works at Angelfire and could help me out with something.
06349befb796253bcead57bcff9f6ca7 (20:10): Let me know.
361699642668dafef3cdea989c6c5007 (20:10): Does anyone know if there's a difference in how the mainstream browsers handle instances of a form with multiple fields having the same name?
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (20:11): Elazar: Not that I can think of.
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (20:12): Elazar: Or to put it another way, not that has caused me to notice a problem when I've used multiple fields of the same name.
361699642668dafef3cdea989c6c5007 (20:12): Dorward: What browsers do you generally use for testing purposes?
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (20:12): Elazar: IE, Firefox, Opera, Konqueror, Lynx
361699642668dafef3cdea989c6c5007 (20:13): Dorward: Good enough for me. :)
ac4200e0e7b208c73dcdb66cb39aa561 (20:13): can't use td width="" ?
ac4200e0e7b208c73dcdb66cb39aa561 (20:14): HTML 4.01 strict

361699642668dafef3cdea989c6c5007 (20:14): Dorward: So behavior doesn't vary between browsers? Or does that depend on server-side processing? I would assume the value of the last instance of a field with a particular name overrides the values of previous instances.
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (20:15): Elazar: No. All the data is sent to the server. foo=bar&foo=baz&foo=somethingElse
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (20:15): terje-: No. Its presentational, Strict has the vast majority of presentational left overs from HTML 3.x stripped out.
ac4200e0e7b208c73dcdb66cb39aa561 (20:16): Dorward, thanks
ac4200e0e7b208c73dcdb66cb39aa561 (20:16): Dorward, what can I use instead?
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (20:16): terje-: Stylesheets
ac4200e0e7b208c73dcdb66cb39aa561 (20:16): But I want to use tables?
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (20:16): terje-: That doesn't stop you using stylesheets.
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (20:17): terje-: You put your data in a table (with suitable table heading cells, thead, tfoot and tbody elements, captions if applicable), then you style the table.
ac4200e0e7b208c73dcdb66cb39aa561 (20:17): Ok, I can live with one error :)
ac4200e0e7b208c73dcdb66cb39aa561 (20:17): my whole site only has one html error, and it's the width, but it makes the page look ok in FF and IE
ac4200e0e7b208c73dcdb66cb39aa561 (20:17): and I'm not very up to date on CSS
0f870ace0a4b9665e30aafebc5bc149c (20:18): Dorward: okay, I won't use it
8c873dd996b190844ebfe7cfed2af7b7 (20:18): terje-: Not very upto date? It hasn't changed since the turn of the millenium!
ac4200e0e7b208c73dcdb66cb39aa561 (20:18): Dorward, I was never up to date on it :-)
ac4200e0e7b208c73dcdb66cb39aa561 (20:18): Does the site look OK? http://rdp.no
361699642668dafef3cdea989c6c5007 (20:21): Dorward: Cool. Thanks again.
